intro: Cleistanthus siamensis, commonly known as the Siam cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
